title: [K-12] Social Media Data Science Sandbox: Analyzing Social Phenomena Through Open Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Data Analysis Concepts, Programming Experience (Python Recommended), and Foundational Social Science Research Methodology
context.additional_context: Students are organized into 5-6 member teams, conducting projects using university-provided laptops and access to social media APIs

learning_goals: Students can scrape and clean Twitter/X data and save it in CSV/JSON formats.
Students can generate and interpret data visualizations (infographics, dashboards) based on research questions related to social phenomena.
Students can collaboratively submit data-driven social science reports (5â€“10 pages) per team based on analysis results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
